title: Fix inefficiency in RichProgressbar
problem: Inefficiency in high-frequency metric rendering function, inside Pytorch Lightning's RichProgressBar
bullets:
Replaced in-loop string concatenations with a generator expression,
improving runtime efficiency by 10%
benchmarked and visualized performance gains using timeit

title: Introduce configurable metric formatting in RichProgressBar
problem: The RichProgressBar displays metrics as 3-decimal floats, which is not precise enough for tracking loss values in extreme ranges
bullets: Introduced configurable formatting and precision for displayed metrics

title: Remove batch size argument warning when unjustified
problem: The StaticCache module for caching attention keys and values for transformers models uses a deprecated batch size parameter, causing warnings even with correct usage
bullets: Refactored the StaticCache module to remove the reliance on the batch size parameter

title: Improve default metric formatting for RichProgressbar
problem: The default display configuration does not report metrics in a stable and readable way
bullets: Introduced consistent decimal precision for all metric values
Implemented unit tests for verifying configurable formatting

title: Introduce configurable delimiter in RichProgressbar
problem: The metrics display is not flexible enough
bullets: Introduced configurable delimiter, supporting more stable metric displays

title: Support cycling through windows
problem: Only one open window per application can be activated
bullets: Added functionality to cycle through open windows of an application

title: Add mouse scroll support
problem: No custom event handling for mouse scrolls
bullets: Enabled running custom actions on mouse scrolling events with modifier keys

title: Add new variable for external cursor mode
problem: Cursor turns into disturbing block when running scripts
bullets:
Introduced configurable external cursor shape,
enabling users to specify cursor shape during script executions

title: Support multiple users
problem: Programs running in different sessions interfere with the detection of open applications
bullets: Introduced multi-user support by making pgrep only consider programs running for a specific user
